title: OIDC server is erroneously shown as not available
body:
### Describe the bug

I have an app, which uses `quarkus-oidc` and connects to keycloak server. When I deploy the app and keycloak server to OpenShift instance, app fails with "OIDC Server is not available" despite the server being available from the app pod

### Expected behavior

App establishes a connection to keycloak server

### How to Reproduce?

1.  `git@github.com:fedinskiy/reproducer.git -b rhsso-no-server`
2. Deploy keycloak:
```
oc create project reproducer
oc create configmap keycloak-realm --from-file keycloak-realm.json
oc apply -f keycloak.yaml
oc expose svc/rhsso --port=8080
oc scale deployment/rhsso --replicas=1
```
3. Deploy the app:
```
route=$(oc get route rhsso -o template --template='{{.spec.host}}')
mvn clean package -Dquarkus.oidc.auth-server-url=http://${route}/realms/test-mutual-tls-realm
```
4. Check deployment:
```
$ oc get pods,routes
NAME                         READY   STATUS      RESTARTS   AGE
pod/app-1-build              0/1     Completed   0          35m
pod/app-776776dcd4-2p58r     1/1     Running     0          16m
pod/rhsso-759d5ddc55-82hn9   1/1     Running     0          76m

NAME                             HOST/PORT                                          PATH   SERVICES   PORT   TERMINATION   WILDCARD
route.route.openshift.io/app     app-reproducer.apps.${EDITED}            app        http                 None
route.route.openshift.io/rhsso   rhsso-reproducer.apps.${EDITED}          rhsso      8080                 None
```
5. Try to access app:
`$ curl http://app-reproducer.apps.${EDITED} 
{"details":"Error id 46860153-0184-4e51-bb27-2ce0670cded5-2","stack":""}`
6. Check app logs: `$ oc logs app-776776dcd4-2p58r` for the error above
7. Check, that keycloak server is accessible:
```
$ curl http://${route}/realms/test-mutual-tls-realm
{"realm":"test-mutual-tls-realm","public_key":"$EDITED","token-service":"http://rhsso-reproducer.${EDITED}/realms/test-mutual-tls-realm/protocol/openid-connect","account-service":"http://rhsso-reproducer.${EDITED}realms/test-mutual-tls-realm/account","tokens-not-before":0}
```
8. Check, that  keycloak server is accessible from the app pod:
```
echo http://${route}/realms/test-mutual-tls-realm # copy
$ oc rsh pod/app-776776dcd4-2p58r
$ curl $PASTED
{"realm":"test-mutual-tls-realm","public_key":"$EDITED","token-service":"http://rhsso-reproducer.${EDITED}/realms/test-mutual-tls-realm/protocol/openid-connect","account-service":"http://rhsso-reproducer.${EDITED}/realms/test-mutual-tls-realm/account","tokens-not-before":0}
```
